column4: I'm still looking for someone nice that could - maybe - help me with a quite urgent issue. I cannot login to my ubuntu because of $HOME/.dmrc problem.
I just can't access my ubuntu (the GUI; I CAN access the terminal)
I'm in the terminal (on a different computer)
boot into recovery mode and check the ownership and permissions of the file... should be user: youruser; group: youruser; chmod 600
I think that I've done that already.
my .dmrc (umodified since install afaik contain tw simple lines 1: [Desktop] 2: Session=default
firefox is know to use/leak huge amounts of memory
annoying... still, in XP it took me up to 200, maybe 250 MB - but 1 GB ??
sudo lsof /dev/snd/*
thanks
packages.ubuntu.com
thanks; though, I don't find it... is it possible that it is not listed?
looks like is fixed in maverick's mplayer
oh, I see; how can I get it, if I can at all, then? (thanks for your reply!)
dunno maybe you can request it to be backported to lucid
don't you think I can find a .deb file of it somewhere?
well you can try to install the maverick version but probably it wont work to well

requesting such a thing sounds like a very long thing. All I want is to watch a movie tonight... and I am working on it for 3 hours already. I have also tried 3 times to compile it on my own, with no luck...
vlc? xine? totem?
vlc, for some weird reason, don't keep the pace of the hebrew subtitles -- no matter how I fix the delay and the rate, it ignores it. mplayer does it perfectly -- but shows the subtitles flipped.
xine displays Gibberish instead of Hebrew (can't get the proper encoding)
:S. as i said you can try to get the package from packages.ubuntu.com dunno if it would install ( dependencies )
and totem kills my cpu, and the movie runs very slowly :)  --  I'll try to get the maverick one. thanks!
